Class WordParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordParser

  • public class WordParser
extends Object
    This utility class provides a consistent way to clean text into a consistent format (lowercase, without special characters), and to split text into words by whitespace.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CLEAN_REGEX
      Regular expression for removing special characters.
      static String SPLIT_REGEX
      Regular expression for splitting text into words by whitespace.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      WordParser()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String clean(String text)
      Converts text into lowercase, replaces special characters with an empty string, and trims whitespace at the start and end of the string.
      static String[] split(String text)
      First cleans text.
      static Set<String> uniqueWords(String text)
      Returns a set of unique words parsed from the provided text.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • clean

        public static String clean(String text)
        Converts text into lowercase, replaces special characters with an empty string, and trims whitespace at the start and end of the string. Special characters include any non-alphanumeric character or whitespace. Allowed characters include "A", "a", "á", "ä", and "9". Unallowed characters include "_", "-", "@", ".", and so on.
        Parameters:
        text - input to clean
        Returns:
        cleaned text
        See Also:
        CLEAN_REGEX

      • split

        public static String[] split(String text)
        First cleans text. If the result is non-empty, splits the cleaned text into words by whitespace. The result will be an array of words in all lowercase without any special characters, or an empty array if the cleaned text was empty.
        Parameters:
        text - input to clean and split into words
        Returns:
        array of words (or an empty array if cleaned text is empty)
        See Also:
        clean(String), SPLIT_REGEX

      • uniqueWords

        public static Set<String> uniqueWords(String text)
        Returns a set of unique words parsed from the provided text.
        Parameters:
        text - input to parse
        Returns:
        set of unique words from input
        See Also:
        split(String)
